data.question: What is the formula for compound 1?
Which compound showed a reversible hydrogen sorption according to the text?
What process was used to remove DMF molecules from compound 4?
Is the π-π interaction responsible for the structural configuration evolutions of two adjacent digonal pendant groups in compounds 1-3?
What was the yield of compound 1 based on the added amounts of Mn(NO3)2?
Can compound 4vac selectively adsorb benzene over toluene?
What is the role of π-π interactions in the adsorption and separation of C6−C8 aromatics using compound 4vac?
data.answer: They play key roles for the crystal to crystal transformations.

data.question: Did the synthesis of compounds 2 and 3 involve the use of L2 and L3 instead of L1?
What was the method used for the synthesis of Mn(BDC)(L1) (1)?
data.answer: Solvothermal conditions using Mn(NO3)2 aqueous solution, H2BDC, and L1 in DMF at 120 °C.

data.question: Are compounds 1-3 stable in atmospheric conditions for at least six months?
What was the main reason for the structural evolutions from compound 1 to 3?
data.answer: The increase of the substituent methyl group in PNOs.

data.question: Was thermal gravimetric analysis used to indicate the thermal stability of compounds 1-4?
What was the yield of compound 2 based on the added amounts of Mn(NO3)2?
Can compound 4vac selectively adsorb chlorobenzene over benzene?
What was the purpose of using pyridine N-oxide and its derivatives in the synthesis of MnII-based MIL-53 analogues?
data.answer: To serve as neutral μ2 ligands.

data.question: Did the synthesis of compound 4 result in large rod-like red crystals?
What was the formula for the evacuated form of compound 4?
What was the method used to exchange DMF molecules in compound 4 with ethanol?
data.answer: Soaking the mechanically purified compound 4 in ethanol for 2 days.

data.question: Are compounds 1-4 insoluble in common organic solvents?
What was the main factor for the selectivity trend (chlorobenzene > benzene > toluene) of compound 4vac?
data.answer: The different degrees of guest−linker interactions.
